title: Infant's Cap, mid-18th century
medium:
Medium: silk, linen, metallic threads (metal wrapped around a silk core, flat metal strips)
Technique: embroidered using stem, couching and detached interlacing stitches
dimensions: H x W x D: 10.2 x 12.7 x 12.7 cm (4 x 5 x 5 in.)
creditline: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf
description: Christening cap embroidered in multicolored silk with gold and silver threads in a pattern of flower sprays on a ground of couched silver; bordered in gold.

tombstone.epitaph:
Infant's Cap, mid-18th century.
mid-18th century. Medium: silk, linen, metallic threads (metal wrapped around a silk core, flat metal strips)
Technique: embroidered using stem, couching and detached interlacing stitches. Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf. 1962-53-8.
